> Straight Shot nods in reply.  She had tried har=
d to not make the situation appear too severe.  Yet she didn't quite apprec=
iate the fact that Leo Prime's voice sounded a bit ominous.  She goes to Le=
o but with a bit of a serious expression on her face. 
> 
> " Leo, please, =
I think Elita might've picked up on your tone of voice.  We know how seriou=
s the situation is but try explaining that to a little girl who misses her =
parents so much that it breaks her heart just at the mention of something a=
s horrible as this."
> 
> She looks up to him with a look of desperation.
>=
 
> " Please, try not ta send any negative statements if she's around?"
> 
=
> Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 
> 
> On Sep 4, 2011, at 6:3=
0 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
> 
> >> <OLD>
> >> 
>=
 >> Elita: Elita woke up and looking around said "Where is my mommie?"
> >>=
 
> > 
> >> 
> >> Straight Shot swallows hard.  She knew she had to tell th=
e truth and sits
> >> beside Elita while gently rubbing her head.
> >> 
> >=
> " Your mom is on an important mission to see if she can bring your dad
> =
>> back to the Ark.  She asked Talon and me to keep ya safe and watch over
=
> >> ya.  She also told us that if something ever happened to her that she
=
> >> would like Tucson and Talon ta be your guardians.  She loves you very =
much
> >> and she knows that Talon and Tucson will love you just as much, a=
s if you
> >> were their daughter.  And you can bet that Tucson is gonna sp=
oil you
> >> rotten.  Anything you want, he'll do for you".
> >> 
> > 
> >>=
 
> >> "I could have helped her"sobbed Elita"I want my parents back!!!"
> >=
> 
> > 
> >> 
> >> Straight Shot embraces Elita with a supportive arm and h=
olds her lovingly.
> >> " Hey, things will go well, I promise you.  She wil=
l succeed I know she
> >> will.  Besides, with Tucson out there, I'm sure h=
e has a handle on what's
> >> going on and he never strays too far from any=
 of us.  Plus he has the aerial
> >> advantage and from there, he can see a=
nything.  His eyes will be on everyone
> >> including your mom, and if trou=
ble arises, I bet he'll be right there to
> >> help."
> > 
> >> 
> >> Elita=
 sobbed and talon glenty touched the little one
> >> 
> > 
> > <NEW>
> > 
>=
 > LEO PRIME stood looking at NIGHTLIGHT=92s door - He had come looking for=

> > NIGHTLIGHT and instead heard ELITA=92s calls for her mother and the
> =
> general response. He could hear the voices on the other side of the
> > d=
oor as clearly hearing a conversation next to him, his own heightened
> > s=
enses serving him in ways he had not intended.
> > 
> > He frowned as they =
talked. They were evidently trying to help ELITA,
> > but he knew that if T=
USCON was in the jungle he was far too far away
> > to help anyone right no=
w, and if the jungle was as dangerous as the
> > report had received from P=
OLAR CLAW, the TUSCON had his own troubles
> > to worry about.
> > 
> > LEO=
 pressed the door buzzer. He hoped NIGHTLIGHT hadn=92t done what he
> > tho=
ught she had done. =93Talon, Straightshot we need to talk.=94 He said
> > c=
almly, but with a certain edge.
